programme.desc: Louis van Gaal staat bekend als trainer van grote clubs als Ajax, Barcelona, Bayern München en Manchester United. Maar in zijn spelerscarrière stond één club centraal: Sparta Rotterdam. programme.title: Voetbal
programme.desc: De Wedstrijd van je Leven wordt dit jaar gespeeld in het Gelderse Rietmolen. Het eerste elftal van VV Rietmolen speelt op het eigen sportpark tegen een team van ex-profs onder leiding van coach Theo Janssen. Onder meer Andy van der Meijde, Bram van Polen, Tom Beugelsdijk en Stefanie van der Gragt komen in actie en Bas Nijhuis is de scheidsrechter van dienst. Aletha Leidelmeijer presenteert, Hans Kraay jr. doet de interviews en het wedstrijdcommentaar komt van Koert Westerman.

programme.title: Navratilova v Evert 1984
programme.desc: Martina Navratilova completed her dominant march to the 1984 US Open women's title, as she defeated the home favourite Chris Evert in a fervent Flushing Meadows atmosphere.

programme.title: ATP Final: Miami
programme.desc: Chasing a record seventh men's Miami crown, Novak Djokovic - now the oldest ATP Masters 1000 finalist - takes on Jakub Mensik, aiming to win his first tour-level trophy. (30.03)

programme.title: WTA Final: Miami
programme.desc: In Miami, the women's final get underway as top seed Aryna Sabalenka meets with home favourite Jessica Pegula in a repeat of last year's US Open decider. (29.03)

programme.title: ATP Final: Marseille
programme.desc: After upsetting top seed Daniil Medvedev in the semi-finals, Hamad Medjedovic targets the Open 13 Provence title as the 21-year-old Serb meets reigning champion Ugo Humbert. (16.02)

programme.title: ATP Final: Delray Beach
programme.desc: A first tour-level title is within reach for Alejandro Davidovich Fokina, as the Spaniard looks to overcome seventh seed Miomir Kecmanovic of Serbia in the Delray Beach Open final. (16.02)

programme.title: WTA Final: Strasbourg
programme.desc: Elena Rybakina's first final of the 2025 season arrives in Strasbourg with the top seed taking on Liudmila Samsonova, who boasts a 4-1 lead in the pair's head-to-head record. (24.05)

programme.title: ATP Final: Hamburg
programme.desc: Andrey Rublev appears in his third Hamburg Open final, as the former champion seeks his 351st tour-level victory and a second title here against Italy's Flavio Cobolli. (24.05)

programme.title: WTA Final: Rabat
programme.desc: Maya Joint targets her first WTA Tour singles title as the Australian teenager, who also claimed victory in the Rabat doubles, comes up against unseeded Romanian Jaqueline Cristian. (24.05)

programme.title: ATP Final: Geneva
programme.desc: A chance for Novak Djokovic to join Jimmy Connors and Roger Federer in winning a 100th tour-level title, as the 38-year-old Serb battles Hubert Hurkacz in the Geneva Open final. (24.05)

programme.desc: The two top seeds at the United Cup - the United States and Poland - meet in Sydney in the final with Iga Swiatek up against Coco Gauff, while Taylor Fritz takes on Hubert Hurkacz. (05.01)

programme.title: ATP Final: Hamburg
programme.desc: Andrey Rublev appears in his third Hamburg Open final, as the former champion seeks his 351st tour-level victory and a second title here against Italy's Flavio Cobolli. (24.05)

programme.title: WTA Final: Rabat
programme.desc: Maya Joint targets her first WTA Tour singles title as the Australian teenager, who also claimed victory in the Rabat doubles, comes up against unseeded Romanian Jaqueline Cristian. (24.05)

programme.title: ATP Final: Geneva
programme.desc: A chance for Novak Djokovic to join Jimmy Connors and Roger Federer in winning a 100th tour-level title, as the 38-year-old Serb battles Hubert Hurkacz in the Geneva Open final. (24.05)

programme.title: Graf v Seles 1995
programme.desc: Two greats of professional tennis contested the 1995 women's singles final at the US Open, as Monica Seles - returning from a terrifying on-court ordeal in 1993 - faced Steffi Graf.

programme.title: Agassi v Martin 1999
programme.desc: Andre Agassi's 1999 career renaissance concluded with an unforgettable victory at the US Open, earning a fifth Grand Slam title at the expense of his fellow countryman Todd Martin.

programme.title: Sampras v Agassi 2002
programme.desc: In the men's singles final at the 2002 US Open, Pete Sampras would embark on the final match of his illustrious career, extending his perfect record over Andre Agassi at the New York Slam.

programme.title: ATP Final: Doha
programme.desc: In Doha, Great Britain's Jack Draper - entering his fifth ATP final - comes up against fifth seed and 2020 tournament champion Andrey Rublev in the final of the 2025 Qatar Open. (22.02)

programme.title: WTA Final: Doha
programme.desc: Jelena Ostapenko's near seven-year wait to vie for a WTA 1000 title ends in Doha, as the former Grand Slam champion faces 23-year-old American Amanda Anisimova in an unseeded final. (15.02)

programme.title: ATP Final: Dubai
programme.desc: A men's singles champion is crowned in the final of the Dubai Duty Free Tennis Championships, an ATP Tour 500 event in the United Arab Emirates. (01.03)

programme.title: WTA Final: Dubai
programme.desc: A women's singles champion is crowned in Dubai. Russia's Mirra Andreeva - the youngest-ever WTA finalist - and Denmark's Clara Tauson face off for glory. (22.02)

programme.title: ATP Final: Indian Wells
programme.desc: Britain's Jack Draper competes in his maiden ATP Masters 1000 final at Indian Wells as the top-10 bound Brit faces Holger Rune. Draper knocked out Carlos Alcaraz in the last four. (16.03)

programme.title: WTA Final: Indian Wells
programme.desc: Mirra Andreeva meets top seed Aryna Sabalenka in the Indian Wells final. Sabalenka avenged her Australian Open defeat to Keys in the semis, while Andreeva dethroned Swiatek. (16.03)

programme.title: ATP Final: Miami
programme.desc: Chasing a record seventh men's Miami crown, Novak Djokovic - now the oldest ATP Masters 1000 finalist - takes on Jakub Mensik, aiming to win his first tour-level trophy. (30.03)

programme.title: WTA Final: Miami
programme.desc: In Miami, the women's final get underway as top seed Aryna Sabalenka meets with home favourite Jessica Pegula in a repeat of last year's US Open decider. (29.03)

programme.title: ATP Final: Monte Carlo
programme.desc: Chasing a sixth ATP 1000 title and a first in Monte-Carlo, 21-year-old Spaniard Carlos Alcaraz competes in a blockbuster clash with first-time Masters finalist Lorenzo Musetti. (13.04)

programme.title: ATP Final: Madrid
programme.desc: Britain's Jack Draper steps on court for the Madrid Open final aiming to lift his second Masters 1000 crown, as the 23-year-old faces 14th seed Casper Ruud for the first time. (04.05)

programme.title: WTA Final: Madrid
programme.desc: In a repeat of the 2023 US Open final, two-time Madrid champion Aryna Sabalenka eyes another marquee title against Coco Gauff, who won their only prior clay-court meeting. (03.05)

programme.title: ATP Final: Rome
programme.desc: World number one Jannik Sinner takes on soon-to-be world number two Carlos Alcaraz in a blockbuster Italian Open final. Between them, the pair have won the last five majors. (18.05)

programme.title: WTA Final: Rome
programme.desc: A women's singles champion is crowned at the Italian Open, as home favourite and world number five Jasmine Paolini faces the American Coco Gauff. (17.05)

programme.title: Adam Hills: Foot Fault
programme.desc: Join Adam Hills on his funny and personal campaign to support Para-Standing Tennis' growth as he uncovers the barriers facing aspiring players. Sky Original documentary.
